title: It’s Not Easy Being an Intolerant Californian
sub_head: A politician officially condemns another state but can’t seem to stay away.
body:
Americans increasingly choose to live in states characterized by relatively limited government and toleration of opposing viewpoints. Whether they like to admit it or not, even those who favor big government and intolerance still like to visit.
As for visitors who have turned into full-time residents, the Journal’s Josh Mitchell reports on a significant migration that’s been occurring within the United States:
